text: Barbara Haščáková (born 11 December 1979) is a Slovak singer of pop music. She won the Best Female Singer prize at the Slávik Awards in 1998, following it up with nominations for 1999 and 2000 when the award went to Jana Kirschner. In addition to her solo career, she also formed part of the duo act MC Erik & Barbara with MC Erik. Haščáková moved in 1999 to the United States, where she spent time living in the state of Wyoming. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== *1997: Barbara *1999: Ver, Že Ja *2003: Secrets of Happiness *2006: Me & My Music ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width="1"|Year ! width="120"|Nominated work ! width="200"|Award ! width="200"|Category ! width="75"|Result ! width="1"|Ref |- |1998 |rowspan=3|Herself |rowspan=3|Slávik Awards |rowspan=3|Best Female Singer |Winner | |- |1999 |Nominated | |- |2000 |Nominated | |} ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Slovak female singers Category:People from Košice Category:20th-century women singers Category:21st- century women singers
